pr_title: [TE] Disable alerts if it has no success run within 30 days

timeline.message: [TE] Disable alerts if it has no success run within 30 days
[TE] Check if the update time is null
[TE] Send notification mail when disabling alerts

timeline.author: akshayrai

timeline.bodyText: Can we include some unit tests for this?
timeline.author: akshayrai

replies.bodyText: Currently we don't have a good way to test it. The only way would be integration test. But having more than one integration tests running may cause conflicts. That's why I have to add sequence number in our local integration test.
replies.author: xiaohui-sun

timeline.author: akshayrai

timeline.bodyText:
Can we skip the lastTaskExecutionTime == -1L check?
Isn't that already covered by lastTaskExecutionTime <= currentTimeMills - maxTaskFailMills?
timeline.author: akshayrai

replies.bodyText:
lastTaskExecutionTime == -1L is used for backward compatibility.
Currently we have many long failing alerts have -1L.
replies.author: xiaohui-sun

timeline.bodyText: Clubbing them into one log statement might be easier to debug.
timeline.author: akshayrai

timeline.bodyText: What if the alert was updated(after receiving the below notification) and it still continues to fail? We don't want to disable & notify them again?
timeline.author: akshayrai

replies.bodyText: Yes we want to handle it more conservatively. Give them 30 days grace period.
replies.author: xiaohui-sun

timeline.message: [TE] Updated typo and logs for disabling alerts
